description:
InternshipMore than 7 billion people depend on farms for healthy and affordable food. By 2050, the global population will reach 9.4 billion and farmers will need new ways to deliver on this demand. They'll be seeking options that are economically viable and that will help them remain environmentally sustainable. Granular's software meets this need, making farmers more efficient.

We're growing quickly and looking for a Summer Intern to build out a database on our high-achieving and fast-moving employees. In this role, you'll be responsible for supporting the entire People Operations (POPs) team, by researching and creating resources around workforce data and information.

Your main responsibility will be to organize existing company data and produce recommendations that will have a measurable impact on Granular. You'll receive a list of potential projects from the POPs team to evaluate. With this project list, it'll be your responsibility to better understand each problem by discussing with the relevant stakeholders. After assessing the needs of the stakeholders, you'll be responsible for the full cycle of development from initial data exploration to (if applicable) putting a model into production. (During the cycle, you'll receiving coaching from POPs managers and some support from our awesome Data Science team.)

Additionally, you may identify, research, and develop solutions for employee knowledge and skills gaps. You'll work with the Learning & Development manager, while collaborating with other managers, to gather data, design visualizations and present recommendations. For this work, you'll need to be an energetic, positive, creative, and performance-driven self-starter who can work independently.

What You'll Get To Do:

Support our POPs team by collecting, researching, and analyzing current data on employee engagement, choices, performance, and skills
Partner with internal stakeholders to understand business use cases, design and develop solutions, and present findings
Design solutions to improve data infrastructure and business intelligence to support decision making
Operationalize data processes: provide the team with ad-hoc analysis, dashboards, and reports so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the workforce
Work out of our Champaign, IL, San Francisco, CA, or Des Moines, IA office

Our Ideal Candidate:

Current enrollment in a Bachelor, Masters or PhD program (anticipated graduation in 2020) pursuing Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or analytical field
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools (Excel, GoogleSheets, SQL, R, Python, Tableau, and other statistical or data analysis packages)
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Team player mindset that takes ownership for a collective outcome and helps others along the way
Available to work 40 hours per week
Goal-oriented and self-motivated, with strong interpersonal skills
Comfortable in a fast-paced environment

Who We Are:
Granular combines the leadership and innovation of experienced entrepreneurs, advisors, and investors with the meaningful insights of farmers, agronomists, data scientists and engineers.

Our internal team has the rebellious, innovative business and technical acumen that defines Silicon Valley; this expertise has produced products including Granular Business ( https://granular.ag/farm-management-software/ ), Granular Agronomy ( https://granular.ag/agronomy/ ), AcreValue ( https://granular.ag/acrevalue/ ), and AgStudio.

Founded in February 2014, and backed by leading VC's like Andreessen Horowitz and Google Ventures, Granular is an independent subsidiary of Corteva, a spin off of DowDuPont™. We currently have offices in San Francisco, CA, Champaign, IL, Des Moines, IA and Cumming, GA. Learn more about our company and people here! description:
Data driven decision-making is an integral part of life at Wish. It drives our success with customers and merchants. We’re looking for a talented Data Analyst with supply chain experience to continue to drive decisions company-wide through the use of statistical modeling and machine learning.

You will enjoy working with one of the richest social e-commerce data sets in the world, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products on a regular basis. You should have an extensive background in a quantitative field, a strong research background, and experience working with large data sets. You should be results-driven, highly motivated, and have a track record of using data analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and the success of a product.
What you'll do:
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, machine learning, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our products.
Partner with Engineering and Operations teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities.
Work alongside the Product Managers on the Product team to analyze the results of A/B experiments.
Make recommendations on new experiments to run based on the data, and work alongside the engineering team to make sure features are engineered with data tracking in mind.
Inform, influence, support, and execute our product decisions, product launches, and business strategies.
Who you are:
4+ years experience doing quantitative analysis, preferably for a web or mobile company
BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or other technical field
Experience in SQL or other query languages. Development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)
Understanding of statistics and machine learning techniques (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions, decision trees, clustering, etc.)
Experience manipulating data sets through statistical software (ex. R, SAS) or other methods
Experience with distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)
Experience with data visualization

We're growing quickly and looking for a Summer Intern to build out a database on our high-achieving and fast-moving employees. In this role, you'll be responsible for supporting the entire People Operations (POPs) team, by researching and creating resources around workforce data and information.

You'll receive a list of potential projects from the POPs team to evaluate. With this project list, it'll be your responsibility to better understand each problem by discussing with the relevant stakeholders. After assessing the needs of the stakeholders, you'll be responsible for the full cycle of development from initial data exploration to (if applicable) putting a model into production. (During the cycle, you'll receiving coaching from POPs managers and some support from our awesome Data Science team.)

Additionally, you may identify, research, and develop solutions for employee knowledge and skills gaps. You'll work with the Learning & Development manager, while collaborating with other managers, to gather data, design visualizations and present recommendations. For this work, you'll need to be an energetic, positive, creative, and performance-driven self-starter who can work independently.

Support our POPs team by collecting, researching, and analyzing current data on employee engagement, choices, performance, and skills
Partner with internal stakeholders to understand business use cases, design and develop solutions, and present findings
Design solutions to improve data infrastructure and business intelligence to support decision making
Operationalize data processes: provide the team with ad-hoc analysis, dashboards, and reports so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the workforce
Work out of our Champaign, IL, San Francisco, CA, or Des Moines, IA office

Current enrollment in a Bachelor, Masters or PhD program (anticipated graduation in 2020) pursuing Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or analytical field
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools (Excel, GoogleSheets, SQL, R, Python, Tableau, and other statistical or data analysis packages)
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Team player mindset that takes ownership for a collective outcome and helps others along the way
Available to work 40 hours per week
Goal-oriented and self-motivated, with strong interpersonal skills
Comfortable in a fast-paced environment

Who We Are:
Granular combines the leadership and innovation of experienced entrepreneurs, advisors, and investors with the meaningful insights of farmers, agronomists, data scientists and engineers.

Our internal team has the rebellious, innovative business and technical acumen that defines Silicon Valley; this expertise has produced products including Granular Business ( https://granular.ag/farm-management-software/ ), Granular Agronomy ( https://granular.ag/agronomy/ ), AcreValue ( https://granular.ag/acrevalue/ ), and AgStudio.

Founded in February 2014, and backed by leading VC's like Andreessen Horowitz and Google Ventures, Granular is an independent subsidiary of Corteva, a spin off of DowDuPont™. description:
InternshipMore than 7 billion people depend on farms for healthy and affordable food. By 2050, the global population will reach 9.4 billion and farmers will need new ways to deliver on this demand. They'll be seeking options that are economically viable and that will help them remain environmentally sustainable. Granular's software meets this need, making farmers more efficient.

We're growing quickly and looking for a Summer Intern to build out a database on our high-achieving and fast-moving employees. In this role, you'll be responsible for supporting the entire People Operations (POPs) team, by researching and creating resources around workforce data and information.

Your main responsibility will be to organize existing company data and produce recommendations that will have a measurable impact on Granular. You'll receive a list of potential projects from the POPs team to evaluate. With this project list, it'll be your responsibility to better understand each problem by discussing with the relevant stakeholders. After assessing the needs of the stakeholders, you'll be responsible for the full cycle of development from initial data exploration to (if applicable) putting a model into production. (During the cycle, you'll receiving coaching from POPs managers and some support from our awesome Data Science team.)

Additionally, you may identify, research, and develop solutions for employee knowledge and skills gaps. You'll work with the Learning & Development manager, while collaborating with other managers, to gather data, design visualizations and present recommendations. For this work, you'll need to be an energetic, positive, creative, and performance-driven self-starter who can work independently.

What You'll Get To Do:

Support our POPs team by collecting, researching, and analyzing current data on employee engagement, choices, performance, and skills
Partner with internal stakeholders to understand business use cases, design and develop solutions, and present findings
Design solutions to improve data infrastructure and business intelligence to support decision making
Operationalize data processes: provide the team with ad-hoc analysis, dashboards, and reports so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the workforce
Work out of our Champaign, IL, San Francisco, CA, or Des Moines, IA office

Our Ideal Candidate:

Current enrollment in a Bachelor, Masters or PhD program (anticipated graduation in 2020) pursuing Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or analytical field
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools (Excel, GoogleSheets, SQL, R, Python, Tableau, and other statistical or data analysis packages)
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Team player mindset that takes ownership for a collective outcome and helps others along the way
Available to work 40 hours per week
Goal-oriented and self-motivated, with strong interpersonal skills
Comfortable in a fast-paced environment

Who We Are:
Granular combines the leadership and innovation of experienced entrepreneurs, advisors, and investors with the meaningful insights of farmers, agronomists, data scientists and engineers.

Our internal team has the rebellious, innovative business and technical acumen that defines Silicon Valley; this expertise has produced products including Granular Business ( https://granular.ag/farm-management-software/ ), Granular Agronomy ( https://granular.ag/agronomy/ ), AcreValue ( https://granular.ag/acrevalue/ ), and AgStudio.

They'll be seeking options that are economically viable and that will help them remain environmentally sustainable. Granular's software meets this need, making farmers more efficient.

We're growing quickly and looking for a Summer Intern to build out a database on our high-achieving and fast-moving employees. In this role, you'll be responsible for supporting the entire People Operations (POPs) team, by researching and creating resources around workforce data and information.

Your main responsibility will be to organize existing company data and produce recommendations that will have a measurable impact on Granular. You'll receive a list of potential projects from the POPs team to evaluate. With this project list, it'll be your responsibility to better understand each problem by discussing with the relevant stakeholders. After assessing the needs of the stakeholders, you'll be responsible for the full cycle of development from initial data exploration to (if applicable) putting a model into production. (During the cycle, you'll receiving coaching from POPs managers and some support from our awesome Data Science team.)

Additionally, you may identify, research, and develop solutions for employee knowledge and skills gaps. You'll work with the Learning & Development manager, while collaborating with other managers, to gather data, design visualizations and present recommendations. For this work, you'll need to be an energetic, positive, creative, and performance-driven self-starter who can work independently.

What You'll Get To Do:

Support our POPs team by collecting, researching, and analyzing current data on employee engagement, choices, performance, and skills
Partner with internal stakeholders to understand business use cases, design and develop solutions, and present findings
Design solutions to improve data infrastructure and business intelligence to support decision making
Operationalize data processes: provide the team with ad-hoc analysis, dashboards, and reports so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the workforce
Work out of our Champaign, IL, San Francisco, CA, or Des Moines, IA office

Our Ideal Candidate:

Current enrollment in a Bachelor, Masters or PhD program (anticipated graduation in 2020) pursuing Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or analytical field
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools (Excel, GoogleSheets, SQL, R, Python, Tableau, and other statistical or data analysis packages)
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Team player mindset that takes ownership for a collective outcome and helps others along the way
Available to work 40 hours per week
Goal-oriented and self-motivated, with strong interpersonal skills
Comfortable in a fast-paced environment

Who We Are:
Granular combines the leadership and innovation of experienced entrepreneurs, advisors, and investors with the meaningful insights of farmers, agronomists, data scientists and engineers.

Our internal team has the rebellious, innovative business and technical acumen that defines Silicon Valley; this expertise has produced products including Granular Business ( https://granular.ag/farm-management-software/ ), Granular Agronomy ( https://granular.ag/agronomy/ ), AcreValue ( https://granular.ag/acrevalue/ ), and AgStudio.
